summary: 1995  was a common year starting on Sunday of the Gregorian calendar.
full_text: Robert Emerson Lucas, Jr.  is an American economist at the University of Chicago. He received the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences in 1995. He has been characterized by N. Gregory Mankiw as "the most influential macroeconomist of the last quarter of the 20th century."
title: Robert Lucas, Jr.
